column4: gandhijee, they do make drivers for ubuntu, so i was thinking they might have the drivers for you along with instructions
is it wrong to post links on here?
depends on the reason.
links are ok if they are being used as tools to do something allowed on this channel (help or ask for help)
are you asking how to know what commands you have available?
you are looking for its "options" or "flags"
that is what man pages are for :-)
i guess its option. idk what flags are
didn't come with a man page lol
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UsingTheTerminal
clamav -h?
ok so the command clam or clamav doesn't work after i installed the package clamav. so how can i find the executables?
dpkg --listfiles clamav
it shows what files are attached to the package. Anything in /usr/bin is probably an executable.
the package
